data.chText: 注意到；意识到；察觉到
data.enText: to notice or become aware of sth

data.chText: 我注意到他举止有些改变。
data.enText: I perceived a change in his behaviour.

data.chText: 她意识到并非一切都顺利。
data.enText: She perceived that all was not well.

data.chText: 发现病人呼吸困难。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: The patient was perceived to have difficulty in breathing.

data.text: This pattern is usually used in the passive.
此句型通常用于被动语态。

data.chText: 将…理解为；将…视为；认为
data.enText: to understand or think of sb/sth in a particular way

data.chText: 这一发现被视为一项重大突破。
data.enText: This discovery was perceived as a major breakthrough.

data.chText: 她没有把自己看成残疾人。
data.enText: She did not perceive herself as disabled.

data.chText: 人们普遍认为他们的运气不佳。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: They were widely perceived to have been unlucky.

data.text: This pattern is usually used in the passive.
此句型通常用于被动语态。
notice ♦ note ♦ detect ♦ observe ♦ witness ♦ perceive

data.chText: 以上各词均含看到、注意到之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to see sth, especially when you pay careful attention to it.
notice

data.chText: 指看（或听）到、注意到、意识到、注意、留意：
data.enText: to see, hear or become aware of sb/sth; to pay attention to sb/sth

data.chText: 我首先注意到的是这屋子里的气味。
data.enText: The first thing I noticed about the room was the smell.
note

data.chText: 指注意、留意：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to notice or pay careful attention to sth

data.chText: 请注意办事处星期一将关闭。
data.enText: Please note (that) the office will be closed on Monday.

data.chText: 该词在商务英语中非常通用：
data.enText: This word is very common in business English.

data.chText: 注意这些价格含增值税。
data.enText: Note that the prices are inclusive of VAT.
detect

data.chText: 指发现、查明、侦察出：
data.enText: to discover or notice sth, especially sth that is not easy to see, hear, etc.

data.chText: 这些检查旨在早期查出疾病。
data.enText: The tests are designed to detect the disease early.
observe

data.chText: 指看到、注意到、观察到：
data.enText: ( formal ) to see or notice sb/sth

data.chText: 最近你注意到什么变化没有？
data.enText: Have you observed any changes lately?

data.chText: 警察注意到一个男人走进了银行。
data.enText: The police observed a man enter the bank.
witness

data.chText: 指当场看到、目击：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to see sth happen

data.chText: 警方呼吁目击这一事件的人与他们联系。
data.enText: Police have appealed for anyone who witnessed the incident to contact them.
perceive

data.chText: 指注意到、意识到、察觉到：
data.enText: ( formal ) to notice or become aware of sth, especially sth that is not obvious

data.chText: 我注意到他的举止在那几个月里有些改变。
data.enText: I perceived a change in his behaviour over those months.
to notice/note/detect/observe/perceive that/how/what/where/who…
to notice/observe/witness sth happen/sb do sth
to barely/hardly/scarcely notice/detect/observe
to be commonly/frequently noticed/noted/observed
to be worth noticing/noting/observing
sb can't/couldn't help noticing/noting/observing

data.chText: 以上各词均含认为、视为、看待之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to think about sb/sth in a particular way.
regard

data.chText: 指认为、视为、看待：
data.enText: to think of sb/sth in a particular way

data.chText: 他似乎是把整件事当成玩笑。
data.enText: He seemed to regard the whole thing as a joke.
consider

data.chText: 指认为、视为、觉得：
data.enText: to think of sb/sth in a particular way

data.chText: 你认为谁对这个事故负有责任？
data.enText: Who do you consider (to be) responsible for the accident?

data.chText: 用regard还是consider？
上述两词意义相同，但用于不同的句型和结构。用于此义时，consider必须与补语或从句连用，可用consider sb/sth to be sth 或consider sb/sth as sth，不过to be或as常常省略不用：
data.enText: These two words have the same meaning, but they are used in different patterns and structures. In this meaning consider must be used with a complement or clause: you can consider sb/sth to be sth or consider sb/sth as sth , although very often the to be or as is left out.

data.chText: 他认为自己是专家。
data.enText: He considers himself an expert.

data.chText: null null
他们被视为高风险群体。
data.enText: They are considered a high-risk group.

data.chText: 用consider that sb/sth is sth亦可，that同样可以省略。
data.enText: You can also consider that sb/sth is sth and again, the that can be left out.

data.chText: regard可用的句型结构较少，最常用的结构是regard sb/sth as sth，但as不可省略：
data.enText: Regard is used in a narrower range of structures. The most frequent structure is regard sb/sth as sth ; the as cannot be left out.
I regard him a close friend.

data.chText: 不可用：
data.enText: You cannot
regard sb/sth to be sth

data.chText: 或
data.enText: or
regard that sb/sth is sth

data.chText: 不过，regard亦可不与名词或形容词补语连用，只与宾语和副词（如sb/sth is highly regarded某人／某事受到高度评价）或副词短语（如regard sb/sth with suspicion/jealousy/admiration以怀疑／妒忌／赞赏的眼光看待某人／某事）连用，consider则不能这样用。
data.enText: However, regard (but not consider in this meaning) can also be used without a noun or adjective complement but with just an object and adverb (sb/sth is highly regarded) or adverbial phrase ( regard sb/sth with suspicion/jealousy/admiration) .
regard or consider?
see

data.chText: 指认为、看待：
data.enText: to have an opinion of sth

data.chText: 设法从她那个角度去看问题。
data.enText: Try to see things from her point of view.
view

data.chText: 指视为、认为、看待：
data.enText: to think of sb/sth in a particular way

data.chText: 你如何看待你自己在公司中的位置？
data.enText: How do you view your position within the company?

data.chText: view与regard、consider意义相同，但较不常用，也较非正式。主要结构有view sb/sth as sb/sth（把…视为…）（as不能省略）和view sb/sth with sth（以…眼光看待…）。
data.enText: View has the same meaning as regard and consider but is slightly less frequent and slightly less formal. The main structures are view sb/sth as sb/sth (you cannot leave out the as ) and view sb/sth with sth .
perceive

data.chText: 指把…视为／认为／理解为…：
data.enText: [often passive] ( rather formal ) to regard sb/sth as sb/sth

data.chText: 这一发现被视为一项重大突破。
data.enText: This discovery was perceived as a major breakthrough.
to regard/consider/see/view/perceive sb/sth as sth
to regard/consider/see/view/perceive sb/sth from a particular point of view
to consider sb/sth to be sth
to consider that…
generally/usually regarded/considered/seen/viewed/perceived as sth
to regard/consider/see/view/perceive sb/sth favourably/unfavourably

simple_means.memory_skill: per 贯穿 + ceive 抓 → 全部抓住 → 发觉

ex.chText: 他太年轻了，没有人把他当总裁看。
ex.enText: He was so young that no one perceived him as a chief executive.

ex.chText: 即便在学校考试中考得很糟糕，也不要认为自己很失败。
ex.enText: Don't perceive yourself to be a failure even if you do badly in school tests.

synonyms.bx: 指以某种方式看待某人或某事物。

ex.chText: 她完全明白得到校长同意的意义。
ex.enText: She fully appreciated the significance of obtaining the permission from the principal.

ex.chText: 我们理解，为学生们做饭是份重要的工作。
ex.enText: We appreciate that cooking for students is an important job.

ex.chText: 我了解了父亲曾经面临的困难。
ex.enText: I appreciated the difficulties my father had faced.

synonyms.bx: 指了解局面、问题的严重性或重要性，或指了解别人的感受。

ex.chText: 她没有完全理解他说的话。
ex.enText: She did not fully comprehend what he had said.

ex.chText: 她终于明白她妹妹是想借钱。
ex.enText: Finally, she comprehended that her sister wanted to borrow money.

synonyms.bx: 指理解复杂或难懂的事物。

ex.chText: 看黑板。
ex.enText: Look at the blackboard.

ex.chText: 瞧瞧我的新车。
ex.enText: Look at my new car.

ex.chText: 她蒙上眼睛，不敢看。
ex.enText: She covered her eyes, afraid to look.

synonyms.bx: 侧重短暂的看的动作，但并不一定能看见，有时用来唤起别人的注意。

ex.chText: 我们难以观察到月亮的另一面。
ex.enText: The far side of the moon is difficult for us to observe.

ex.chText: 数以千计的人观看了轮船离港下水的情形。
ex.enText: Thousands of people observed the ship leaving the harbour.

ex.chText: 这名科学家仔细观察标本。
ex.enText: The scientist carefully observed the specimen.

synonyms.bx: 指注意到某事物，或为了解某人、某事而对其进行仔细观察。

ex.chText: 我发觉他的行为有些变化。
ex.enText: I perceived a change in his behaviour.

ex.chText: 我看不出这些图片有什么差别。
ex.enText: I can't perceive any difference between these pictures.

ex.chText: 她被视为未来的总裁。
ex.enText: She is perceived as the future president.

synonyms.bx: 指发现或意识到某事；也指以某种方式理解某人或某事。

ex.chText: 他看了看，但什么也没有看见。
ex.enText: He looked but saw nothing.

ex.chText: 从这儿可以看到好几英里远。
ex.enText: You can see for miles from here.

ex.chText: 你昨晚看那个节目了吗？
ex.enText: Did you see that programme last night?

synonyms.bx: 侧重看的结果；也指眼睛看得见或观看比赛、电视节目等。

ex.chText: 看电视
ex.enText: watch television

ex.chText: 下次你们参观动物园，要仔细观察老虎。
ex.enText: Next time you visit the zoo, watch the tigers carefully.

ex.chText: 你能推荐一个我们可以观看美丽日出的地方吗？
ex.enText: Can you recommend a place where we can watch the beautiful sunrise?

synonyms.bx: 指在一段时间内关注某人或某事。

example: She finally perceived the futility of her protest

tr: to become aware of through the senses
example: I could perceive the ship coming over the horizon

value.def: If you perceive something, you see, notice, or realize it, especially when it is not obvious.

example.ex: A key task is to get pupils to perceive for themselves the relationship between success and effort...
example.tran: 关键任务是让学生们自己认识到成功和努力之间的关系。

example.ex: 'Precisely what other problems do you perceive?' she asked.
example.tran: “你究竟还发现了什么问题？”她问道。

value.tran: 注意到，察觉，意识到（尤指不明显之物）

value.def: If you perceive someone or something as doing or being a particular thing, it is your opinion that they do this thing or that they are that thing.

example.ex: Stress is widely perceived as contributing to coronary heart disease...
example.tran: 压力被广泛认为是导致冠心病的一个因素。

example.ex: They strangely perceive television as entertainment.
example.tran: 奇怪的是，他们居然将电视看作娱乐。

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to take, to hold, to seize 拿, 抓, 握住
rootsaffixes.title: cap(t), cep(t), ceive, cip, cup

partsOfSpeech.dec: ac 加强 + cept 拿，抓，握住 → 一再拿 → 接受
accept 接受 + ability 可…性 → 可接受性
anti〔= ante 前面〕+ cip 拿，抓，握住 + ate 做，造成，使… → 提前把握〔事物发展结果〕→ 预料
cap 拿，抓，握住 + acious 多…的 →〔有地方〕可多拿的 → 宽阔的
cap 拿，抓，握住 + acity 性质，状态，情况 → 抓住〔事物〕的能力 → 才能
capt 拿，抓，握住 + ain 表人 → 掌握一群人 → 首领
cap 拿，抓，握住 + tion 表名词 → 抓住〔文章的大意〕→ 标题
capt 拿，抓，握住 + ious …的 → 抓人〔毛病〕的 → 吹毛求疵的
captiv〔e〕俘虏 + ate 使… → 使…变成俘虏 → 迷惑
capt 拿，抓，握住 + ive 表人 → 抓住〔的人〕→ 俘虏
capt 拿，抓，握住 + ure 表行为 → 抓住 → 逮捕
con 共同 + ceive 拿，抓，握住 → 大家一起抓〔思想〕→ 想像；构想
con 共同 + cept 拿，抓，握住 + ion 表名词 → 共同把握住的〔思想〕→ 观念
de 否定，非 + ceive 拿，抓，握住 → 不拿来 → 欺骗
de 否定，非 + cept 拿，抓，握住 + ive …的 → 不拿来 → 欺骗性的
e 出 + man 手 + cip 拿，抓，握住 + ate 做，造成，使… → 把被抓的手放出来 → 解放
ex 出 + cept 拿，抓，握住 → 拿出去 → 把…除外
in 进入 + cept 拿，抓，握住 + ion 表名词 →〔开始〕进来拿 → 开端
in 进入 + cip 拿，抓，握住 + ient …的 → 开始的，初期的
inter 在…之间 + cept 拿，抓，握住 → 在〔路程间〕抓人）→ 拦截
oc 加强 + cup 拿，抓，握住 + ant 人 → 一再拿的人 → 占有者
oc 加强 + cup 拿，抓，握住 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 职业；占有
oc 加强 + cup 拿，抓，握住 + y 表行为 → 占领；使用
per 贯穿 + ceive 拿，抓，握住 → 全部抓住 → 发觉
pre 预先 + cept 拿，抓，握住 → 预先掌握的〔话〕→ 箴言
pre 预先 + occupation 职业；占有 → 首先占有〔注意力〕→ 全神贯注
re 一再 + ceive 拿，抓，握住 → 一再拿到 → 收到
re 一再 + cept 拿，抓，握住 + acle 表物 → 装了可以再装的物品 → 容器
sus 下 + cept 拿，抓，握住 + ible …的 → 容易被〔病〕抓住的 → 易患病的
